titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 2002) making appropriations for the Department of Transportation and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1996, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 104-195, by Mrs. Waldholtz.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2002 with 1 hour of general debate. Motion to recommit with or without installowed. The rule waives clause 3 of rule XIII (requiring a committee bill report contain the text of the statute being repealed within that committee bill) and section 401 (a) of the Budget Act (prohibiting consideration of legislation, as reported, providing new contract authority) against consideration of the bill. The rule also waives clause 6 (prohibiting reappropriation). Measure will be read by title. Bill is open to amendments. Provides for the consideration of an amendment by Mr. Solomon printed in Part 2 of the report accompanying this resolution.The amendment is not subject to amendment or to a demand for a division of the question in the House or Committee of the Whole. All points of order are waived against the amendment.Members who have pre-printed their amendmen...

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 76.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 217 - 202 (Roll No. 546).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 7/21/1995--Passed House amended. Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 2002 (FY 1996 appropriations for the Department of Transportation and related agencies).
